column4: Question/Problem: My Optical Drives are detected but they don't detect a Blank CD-R.
did you enable it in menu > system > prefs > removable media ... ?
it's set to automount anything
do you have the correct command to start the prog ?
well I'm using the launcher in the menu to launch GnomeBaker to burn a CD.
that app I directed you to  has a switch in it to start a prog when blank media is mounted
all the "ticks" are marked off, so I'd assume all should 'just work' as it did in Edgy.
just reviewing the basic
ok, thanks :-)
any other ideas on why my drives ARE detected but no cd-r's?
not realy,  I assume you have tried several cd to make sure it wasn't one borked one
and itworks in other OS ? and it reads cd fine ?
do you mean you can'T burn cd at all ? I thought you were just complaiing that it didn' auto start
I can't burn a CD because the CD-RW drive doesn't detect when I put a disk in there
check the device manager  and make sure the cdrw is recognised properly
I'll check
all seems fine in the "device manager"
check the forum
is the cd damaged ?
why does it need to be force mounted ?
maybe dbus is messed-up
will it mount manualy ?
in the terminal   mount /dev/cdrom1 /media/cdrom
